    • Field Detail

      • FLAG_READER_NFC_Q

        public static final int FLAG_READER_NFC_Q
        Flag for use with #enableReaderMode(Activity, ReaderCallback, int, Bundle).

        Setting this flag enables polling for Nfc-Q(Quiet tag) technology.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • nfcSelfTest

        public int nfcSelfTest​(int type)
                throws java.io.IOException
        This API is called by application to execute the analog self test

        Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

      • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
Parameters:
type - , type of the analog slef test
Returns:
status
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a failure occurred during nfcSelfTest

  • getNxpNfcAdapterExtrasInterface

    public INxpNfcAdapterExtras getNxpNfcAdapterExtrasInterface()

  • mPOSSetReaderMode

    public int mPOSSetReaderMode​(java.lang.String pkg,
                             boolean on)
                      throws java.io.IOException
    This is the first API to be called to start or stop the mPOS mode

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
  • This api shall be called only when there are no NFC transactions ongoing
Parameters:
pkg - package name of the caller
on - Sets/Resets the mPOS state.
Returns:
whether the update of state is success or busy or fail. MPOS_STATUS_BUSY MPOS_STATUS_REJECTED MPOS_STATUS_SUCCESS
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a failure occurred during reader mode set or reset

  • mPOSGetReaderMode

    public boolean mPOSGetReaderMode​(java.lang.String pkg)
                          throws java.io.IOException
    This is provides the info whether mPOS mode is activated or not

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
  • This api shall be called only when there are no NFC transactions ongoing
Parameters:
pkg - package name of the caller
Returns:
TRUE if reader mode is started FALSE if reader mode is not started
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a failure occurred during reader mode set or reset

  • configureSecureReader

    public int configureSecureReader​(boolean on,
                                 java.lang.String readerType)
                          throws java.io.IOException
    This is the first API to be called to configure the SCR mode

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
  • This api shall be called only when there are no NFC transactions ongoing
Parameters:
on - Sets/Resets the Secure Reader state.
Requested - reader type. e.g. Mifare Classic Reader("MFC")
Returns:
whether the update of state is success or busy or fail or rejected. SCR_STATUS_BUSY SCR_STATUS_REJECTED SCR_STATUS_SUCCESS SCR_STATUS_FAILED
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a failure occurred during reader mode set or reset

  • stopPoll

    public void stopPoll​(java.lang.String pkg,
                     int mode)
              throws java.io.IOException
    This API is called by application to stop RF discovery

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
Parameters:
pkg - package name of the caller
mode - LOW_POWER ULTRA_LOW_POWER
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a failure occurred during stop discovery

  • getMaxAidRoutingTableSize

    public int getMaxAidRoutingTableSize()
                              throws java.io.IOException
    This api is called by applications to get the maximum routing table for AID registration The returned value doesn't provide the current remaining size available for AID. This value depends on the size available in NFCC and is constant.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    Returns:
    maximum routing table size for AID registration.
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs while retrieving the size.

  • getCommittedAidRoutingTableSize

    public int getCommittedAidRoutingTableSize()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
    This api is called by applications to get the size of AID data which is already committed to routing table in NFCC.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    Returns:
    occupied size of routing table for AID registrations.
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs while retrieving the size.

  • getFwVersion

    public byte[] getFwVersion()
                    throws java.io.IOException
    Get the current NFCC firware version.
    Returns:
    2 byte array with Major ver(0 index) adn Minor ver(1 index)
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException

  • setConfig

    public int setConfig​(java.lang.String configs,
                     java.lang.String pkg)
              throws java.io.IOException
    This api is called by applications to update the NFC configurations which are already part of libnfc-nxp.conf and libnfc-brcm.conf

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
    • This api shall be called only when there are no NFC transactions ongoing
    Parameters:
    configs - NFC Configuration to be updated.
    pkg - package name of the caller
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not. 0xFF - failure 0x00 - success
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • selectUicc

    public int selectUicc​(int uiccSlot)
               throws java.io.IOException
    This api is called by applications to select the UICC slot. Selected Slot will be activated for all type of CE from UICC.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
    Parameters:
    uicc - slot number to select
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not. 0xFF - failure 0x00 - success
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • getSelectedUicc

    public int getSelectedUicc()
                    throws java.io.IOException
    This api is called by applications to get Selected UICC slot. Selected Slot will be used for all type of CE from UICC.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
    Parameters:
    uicc - slot number to select
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not. 0xFF - failure 0x00 - success
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • setFieldDetectMode

    public int setFieldDetectMode​(boolean mode)
    This api is called by applications enable or disable field detect feauture.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
    Parameters:
    Mode - to Enable(true) and Disable(false)
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not with reason. 0x01 - NFC_IS_OFF, 0x02 - NFC_BUSY_IN_MPOS 0x03 - ERROR_UNKNOWN 0x00 - SUCCESS
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • isFieldDetectEnabled

    public boolean isFieldDetectEnabled()
    This api is called by applications to check whether field detect feature is enabled or not

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
    Parameters:
    None -
    Returns:
    whether the feature is enabled(true) disabled (false) success or not. Enabled - true Disabled - false
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • startRssiMode

    public int startRssiMode​(int rssiNtfTimeIntervalInMillisec)
    This api is called by applications to start RSSI mode. Once RSSI is enabled, RSSI data notifications are broadcasted to registered application when the device is in the reader field. Application can then analyze this data and find best position for transaction.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only after Nfcservice is enabled.
    Parameters:
    rssiNtfTimeIntervalInMillisec - to set time interval between RSSI notification in milliseconds. It is recommended that this value is greater than 10 millisecs and multiple of 10.
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not with reason. 0x01 - NFC_IS_OFF, 0x02 - NFC_BUSY_IN_MPOS 0x03 - ERROR_UNKNOWN 0x00 - SUCCESS
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • stopRssiMode

    public int stopRssiMode()
    This api is called by applications to stop RSSI mode

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only after Nfcservice is enabled.
    Parameters:
    None -
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not with reason. 0x01 - NFC_IS_OFF, 0x02 - NFC_BUSY_IN_MPOS 0x03 - ERROR_UNKNOWN 0x00 - SUCCESS
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • isRssiEnabled

    public boolean isRssiEnabled()
    This api is called by applications to check whether RSSI is enabled or not

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only after Nfcservice is enabled.
    Parameters:
    None -
    Returns:
    whether the feature is enabled(true) disabled (false) success or not. Enabled - true Disabled - false
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • activateSeInterface

    public int activateSeInterface()
                        throws java.io.IOException
    This api is called by applications to Activate Secure Element Interface.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not. 0x03 - failure 0x00 - success 0xFF - Service Unavialable
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • deactivateSeInterface

    public int deactivateSeInterface()
                          throws java.io.IOException
    This api is called by applications to Deactivate Secure Element Interface.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

    • This api shall be called only Nfcservice is enabled.
    Returns:
    whether the update of configuration is success or not. 0x03 - failure 0x00 - success 0xFF - Service Unavialable
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs during setting the NFC configuration.

  • doWriteT4tData

    public int doWriteT4tData​(byte[] fileId,
                          byte[] data,
                          int length)
    This API performs writes of T4T data to Nfcee.
    Parameters:
    fileId - File Id to which to write
    data - data bytes to be written
    length - current data length
    Returns:
    number of bytes written if success else negative number of error code listed as here . -1 STATUS_FAILED -2 ERROR_RF_ACTIVATED -3 ERROR_MPOS_ON -4 ERROR_NFC_NOT_ON -5 ERROR_INVALID_FILE_ID -6 ERROR_INVALID_LENGTH -7 ERROR_CONNECTION_FAILED -8 ERROR_EMPTY_PAYLOAD -9 ERROR_NDEF_VALIDATION_FAILED

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • doReadT4tData

    public byte[] doReadT4tData​(byte[] fileId)
    This API performs reading of T4T content of Nfcee.
    Parameters:
    fileId - : File Id from which to read
    Returns:
    read bytes :-Returns read message if success Returns null if failed to read Returns 0xFF if file is empty.

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • startExtendedFieldDetectMode

    public int startExtendedFieldDetectMode​(int detectionTimeout)
    This API starts extended field detect mode.
    Parameters:
    detectionTimeout - : The time after 1st RF ON to exit extended filed detect mode(msec).
    Returns:
    status :-0x00 :EFDSTATUS_SUCCESS 0x01 :EFDSTATUS_FAILED 0x02 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_ALREADY_STARTED 0x03 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED 0x04 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_FEATURE_DISABLED_IN_CONFIG 0x05 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_NFC_IS_OFF 0x06 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • stopExtendedFieldDetectMode

    public int stopExtendedFieldDetectMode()
    This API stops extended field detect mode.
    Returns:
    status :-0x00 :EFDSTATUS_SUCCESS 0x01 :EFDSTATUS_FAILED 0x05 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_NFC_IS_OFF 0x06 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN 0x07 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_NOT_STARTED

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.

  • startCardEmulation

    public int startCardEmulation()
    This API starts card emulation mode. Starts RF Discovery with Default POLL & Listen configurations
    Returns:
    status :-0x00 :EFDSTATUS_SUCCESS 0x01 :EFDSTATUS_FAILED 0x05 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_NFC_IS_OFF 0x06 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_UNKNOWN 0x07 :EFDSTATUS_ERROR_NOT_STARTED

    Requires android.Manifest.permission#NFC permission.
